description.content: The theme focuses on the journey of participants through different stages of technical mastery, from trivia to time-based coding challenges, culminating in a final high-stakes conquest. It aligns with the structured rounds and competitive spirit of the event.
To empower students to work under pressure, experience unexpected workplace scenarios through simulation, and increase domain knowledge through quizzes and subject mastery.

items: Relay format: C language (45 mins) + Python (45 mins)
Points based on difficulty (Easy: 5, Medium: 10, Hard: 20)
Evaluation criteria: Accuracy, Completion, Presentation, Approach

name: VERBO FIESTA - An Exciting Verbal Arena

description.content: VERBO FIESTA - An Exciting Verbal Arena

VERBO FIESTA is a thrilling verbal showdown where participants battle it out in a series of events aimed at testing their public speaking, debating, and creative thinking skills. Whether you're making persuasive arguments, selling a product, or weaving words together, this event will challenge your communication abilities in exciting and unexpected ways.

To promote verbal dexterity, critical thinking, creativity, and teamwork through fun and competitive challenges. The event aims to enhance public speaking and problem-solving skills in an engaging environment.

items: Challenges testing debate, creativity, and quick thinking

description.content: Participants engage in a formal debate on a motion, with one speaker advocating for the motion and the other against it.

items: Eligibility: Students from the designated institution
Team of two (one for the motion, one against)
Each speaker gets 3 minutes, followed by a 1-minute rebuttal
Judging Criteria: Content, Clarity, Confidence, and Rebuttal

description.content: In this event, participants pick an item randomly and attempt to sell it using their persuasive communication skills.

items: Both team members must contribute equally
Use creative and original advertising techniques

description.content: Word Weave is a team-based game that challenges participants to form creative, grammatically correct sentences using randomly assigned words.

items: At least four teams (A, B, C, D) required
Create a sentence using 3 random words in 1-2 minutes
Sentence must be meaningful, grammatically correct, and creative

description.content: JAM (Just a Minute) is a fun and fast-paced event where participants are given a topic and must speak about it for one minute without hesitation, repetition, or deviation.

items: Team-based or individual participation, as specified in each event

description.content: Day 1: Introduction to UI/UX & Figma Basics

Duration: 2.5 Hours

Kick off your design journey with an exciting introduction to the world of UI/UX design and Figma! We’ll start with a warm welcome and an overview of what you’ll achieve over the next three days. After a fun icebreaker, dive into the essentials of UI (User Interface) and UX (User Experience) design, exploring key principles like usability, accessibility, and consistency.

items: Learn the difference between UI and UX

description.content: Dive deeper into design principles like typography, color theory, and spacing. Explore Figma’s prototyping tools to link frames, add interactions, and create multi-screen prototypes. End with a sharing session to present work and receive feedback.

Focus on collaboration and usability testing. Work in teams to refine prototypes, apply feedback, and improve usability. Culminate with final project presentations showcasing your app design and UI/UX principles application. Celebrate achievements with feedback and optional awards!
Perfect for anyone looking to enhance design skills and create interactive, user-friendly prototypes. Bring your laptop with Figma installed!
